image.altText: NT Chief Minister Natasha Fyles,  in a bright pink blazer, standing inside a room and looking at a nearby lectern.

props.synopsis: Independent MLA Mark Turner has referred two matters relating to Natasha Fyles and her office to the Northern Territory Independent Commissioner Against Corruption.

title.children: NT chief minister referred to ICAC over political adviser's gas lobbying ties

image.altText: a young man with short hair sits on a couch while patting his black and white, mixed-breed dog

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Keith Kerinauia, the man accused of murdering 20-year-old Declan Laverty in Darwin earlier this year, are expected to argue their client acted in self-defence before allegedly stabbing the bottle shop worker.

title.children: Man accused of Darwin bottle shop murder expected to argue self-defence, court hears

image.altText: Jim Chalmers speaks at a press conference inside parliament house

props.synopsis: Australians hoping to see their wages grow in real terms will have to wait longer than expected, with the federal government's budget update showing higher-than-forecast inflation savaging the benefits of higher pay.

title.children: Real wages stagnating despite extra billions flowing into federal budget

image.altText: Woman wearing university graduation hat hold certificate and smiles

props.synopsis: Four Flinders University paramedicine students have graduated at a ceremony in Darwin, with hopes more will follow.

title.children: First cohort of locally trained paramedic students graduate in the NT amid workforce shortage

image.altText: A man and woman, with their baby in a pram, looking at the ASX stock market boards in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market opens flat, while Treasurer Jim Chalmers delivers a mid-year economic and fiscal outlook statement. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Treasurer reveals mid-year budget update, ASX opens flat after a modest gain on Wall Street

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: MYEFO assumes big fall in iron ore, coal prices
Albanese government 'within striking distance' of second surplus

image.altText: Barbara Woodward speaks during a meeting of the UN General Assembly.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese joins with leaders from Canada and New Zealand in a joint statement saying "this cannot be one-sided" and condemning both the October 7 Hamas attacks and the humanitarian crisis in Gaza. Follow live.

title.children: World reacts to UN vote calling for ceasefire in Gaza

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: UN ceasefire resolution shows US and Israel 'isolated' in international community
Which nations voted for, against, and abstained?

image.altText: An out-of-focus photo of school children walking across a bridge from street view.

props.synopsis: A Sydney primary school teacher under investigation for historical child sex abuse allegations is removed from classroom duties after questions are raised by ABC Investigations.

title.children: 'I thought the systems were fool-proof': Woman 'devastated' after learning alleged child abuser still teaching

image.altText: A large tree has fallen on the Cairns Esplanade as wind gusts pick up

props.synopsis: Drenching rain and destructive winds have begun in Far North Queensland with Tropical Cyclone Jasper expected to cross the coast between Hopevale and Cairns as a category two system. Follow live.

title.children: Cyclone Jasper to intensify before hitting Queensland coast this afternoon

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Jasper expected to cross the coast as a category two system

image.altText: A landscape image of Jimmy Barnes wearing a black top. The background is out of focus but there is red, orange and blue light

props.synopsis: Musician Jimmy Barnes reveals a bacterial infection he's been battling has spread to his heart.

title.children: Jimmy Barnes to undergo open heart surgery after bacterial infection spreads

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and blue top smiling

props.synopsis: Two people have been charged with murder, aggravated serious criminal trespass and committing theft using force, and will face court later today.

title.children: Murder charges laid after Adelaide doctor Michael Yung dies in hospital

image.altText: Headshots of Christopher Luxon, Anthony Albanese and Justin Trudeau

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese joins the leaders of New Zealand and Canada to issue a rare joint statement calling for "urgent international efforts towards a sustainable ceasefire" in Gaza.

title.children: Albanese joins NZ, Canada leaders in rare joint statement as Australia supports ceasefire vote at UN

image.altText: Netball players contest the ball

props.synopsis: Netball Australia's bitter dispute with its players is over, after both parties signed a new three-year pay deal that includes a revenue sharing component.

title.children: Netball Australia ends civil war with players, agrees to 'historic' three-year pay deal

image.altText: A composite image of Benjamin Netanyahu and Vladimir Putin.

props.synopsis: In an increasingly troubled world, there are two men who have a clear incentive to keep their wars going – Benjamin Netanyahu and Vladimir Putin, writes John Lyons.

title.children: Two wars, two leaders, one common thread: What Gaza and Ukraine have in common

image.altText: A man sits with two children on his knee outside a wooden cabin.

props.synopsis: Australia could make a world-first decision to ban engineered stone due to the "unacceptable risk to workers", but it's too late for hundreds of people living with silicosis.

title.children: Engineered stone ban on the table, as workers and businesses weigh up the cost

image.altText: Caroline Polachek looks up, wearing a dark blue off the shoulder dress in an orange room with unknown objects

props.synopsis: The art-pop wonder delivered both nostalgic and future-focused pop in one stunning package, with a little help from a 90s pop icon.

title.children: Let's unpack Double J's best albums of 2023

countdowns.title: Get personalised music recommendations from Zan Rowe and the Double J team

image.altText: A screen shot from a website streaming Winki Pop surf beach.

props.synopsis: There are cameras right along Australia's east coast providing a glimpse into the day's surf conditions, but some locals on Victoria's Surf Coast believe a recent addition at a surf break near Bells Beach marks a "violation" of the area's values.

title.children: It's a simple shot of rolling waves, but the camera that filmed it is in the centre of a political storm

image.altText: A photo of a boy with blonde hair smiling at the camera is layered over a photo of a historic school building.

props.synopsis: Ethan says he is "haunted" by the abuse he alleges he suffered at the hands of three different men. He hopes his story inspires other victims to come forward, and a more compassionate approach to civil cases.

title.children: Ethan says he endured years of abuse at a prestigious boarding school. The legal process is a new type of trauma

image.altText: Sky over town of Bright, Victoria with meteors in sky

props.synopsis: Celebrate the end of the year with some fireworks of the celestial kind — this year's Geminid meteor shower could be the best Australia has seen.

title.children: No moon and great timing — just two reasons why this year's Geminid meteor shower will be a total cracker

image.altText: Residents in Port Douglas have been busy filling sandbags in preparation for Tropical Cylone Jasper to make landfall.

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Jasper could bring large swells, storms and "life-threatening floodwaters" to Far North Queensland.

title.children: 'This is an evolving situation': Far North Queensland braces for impact as Tropical Cyclone Jasper approaches

image.altText: Trees fallen over a road

props.synopsis: State Emergency Service and Country Fire Service volunteers responded to multiple calls for help when a storm front came through the town and lightning started a bushfire in Millicent, in SA's south-east.

title.children: 'Tornado' hits South Australian town with damage to houses, trees, and power lines

image.altText: A drone shot of rows of houses in Shell Cove, Wollongong's south.

props.synopsis: Our severe housing problems will only be fixed if policymakers commit to solving them, writes Gareth Hutchens.

title.children: There was a 'housing crisis' in the 1940s and 50s, but Labor and Liberal governments both worked much harder to fix it

image.altText: White phosphorus fired.

props.synopsis: Israel denies using white phosphorus munitions illegally, but the US says it will be seeking more information after fresh reports emerged linking its use to an attack that injured at least nine civilians. This is what we know.

title.children: 'Nasty weapon of war': What we know about Israel's white phosphorus bombs

image.altText: Pat Cummins smiles

props.synopsis: Here is everything you need to know ahead of the first Test between Australia and Pakistan in Perth as the summer of cricket gets underway with the West Test.

title.children: Everything you need to know about the first Test in Perth

image.altText: Black and white photo of Derek Bromley staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man who has spent nearly 40 years behind bars for a murder he says he did not commit has had his bid for freedom rejected by the High Court.

title.children: Adelaide man Derek Bromley loses High Court bid for freedom

image.altText: Seven clear evidence bags of white drugs, a bag of ammunition and a long-barrelled black pistol.

props.synopsis: Police say they have made Tasmania's largest-ever seizure of cocaine and meth, after intercepting a boat that came ashore in a remote Tasmanian shack community.

title.children: Police intercept boat and make largest cocaine and meth bust in Tasmanian history

image.altText: US President Joe Biden shakes hands with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with US President Joe Biden and other senior politicians to discuss US support for Ukraine's war effort.

title.children: 'We're gonna stay at your side': Biden tells Zelenskyy not to give up hope in war against Russia

image.altText: An aerial view looking down at a solar panel farm next to a sand mine with a dozer operating

props.synopsis: You might have heard that mining metals needed for the renewable energy transition could harm the environment, so what's actually happening?

title.children: Solar panels, wind turbines and electric cars all come at the cost of toxic mining waste. So how are we managing this?

image.altText: Red paint is splashed on the glass in front of two Zara mannequins.

props.synopsis: The image at the centre of the criticism shows a model carrying a mannequin wrapped in a white cloth — some shared it on social media alongside photos from the Gaza war coverage showing bodies wrapped in white cloth.

title.children: Zara apologises after deleting photos criticised for evoking Gaza war imagery

image.altText: police secure an empty boat on a beach

props.synopsis: Emergency teams will face the challenge of high winds and a large swell as they resume a search today for a Victorian fisherman whose boat was found washed up on shore near Bermagui in NSW yesterday.

title.children: Rescuers resume search for missing 60yo fisherman after boat with engine running washes up on beach

image.altText: A pic and white plume of smoke can be seen in a vast grass paddock

props.synopsis: The arrival of an explosives manufacturer next to a bushfire-prone paddock in Bogan Gate has locals on edge, as regulators and industry debate how to store ammonium nitrate safely.

title.children: Bogan Gate Explosive Reserve concerns nearby residents

image.altText: A plate of cultured meat.

props.synopsis: Quail is a delicacy for many, and restaurants could soon be serving meat grown from quail cells after Australia's food safety regulator judged cell-cultured quail meat safe to eat.

title.children: Quail meat grown from cells 'safe to eat', says food regulator in Australia-first assessment

image.altText: Three versions of Deep Roy singing in Charlie and the Chocolate factory.

props.synopsis: Deep Roy played 165 Oompa Loompas (including an entire glam rock band) in Tim Burton's 2005 film adaptation of Charlie and the Chocolate Factory. Will Hugh Grant in 2023's Wonka ever measure up?

title.children: Meet Deep Roy, the man who was 165 Oompa Loompas — including an entire glam rock band
